intro: Chrysanthemum asteroides, commonly known as the star chrysanthemum, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy, daisy-like blooms with yellow centers and white or pale pink petals. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes. Chrysanthemum asteroides prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade for optimal growth.
